items.label: What tone should media/storytelling pieces use?

items.label: What tone should Docs/Academy materials use?

blocks.title: Atlas-V Behavior & Messaging
blocks.description: Decide how Atlas-V is described, how active it sounds, and what is public.

items.label: How proactive should Atlas-V sound in marketing copy?
items.description: Defines whether Atlas-V is an assertive commander or a careful guide.

items.label: How much autonomy should we promise Atlas-V delivers?
items.description: Affects claims about automation, autopilot, and human-in-the-loop.

options.label: D — Guidance only, no automation promises

items.label: How much should we emphasize guardrails and governance language?
items.description: Impacts copy about constraints, safety, and policy enforcement.

options.label: A — Heavy emphasis on safety and guardrails

items.label: Should we publicly describe how Atlas-V enforces governance?
items.description: Decides if governance pipelines are exposed beyond high-level mentions.

items.label: Should Atlas-V Lite be presented as a public-facing assistant?
items.description: Determines if Atlas-V Lite gets its own public CTA or is kept conceptual.

items.label: Should references to the Council of Three/internal decision engine be public?
items.description: Clarifies whether internal governance lore is surfaced on pages.

items.label: How should Atlas-V refer to the user/team in copy?
items.description: Determines if Atlas-V addresses readers directly or as collaborators.

items.label: How should we position Atlas-V with respect to data and privacy?
items.description: Controls how much we talk about data boundaries and inputs.

options.label: A — Detailed discussion of data policies
B — Balanced mention of responsible use

items.label: Should we position Atlas-V as offering an API/SDK?
items.description: Impacts whether we imply third-party integration pathways.

items.label: How strongly should we claim Atlas-V prevents off-canon outputs?
items.description: Controls explicitness of safety and governance marketing claims.

items.label: How much should we stress human oversight alongside Atlas-V?
items.description: Determines whether copy highlights approvals and reviewers.

options.label: A — Strong emphasis on human approvals
